Graph coarsening and refinement Exploration policy questions

How to preserve important log properties?
Synoptics Design From logs to graphs
Log invariants Logs often have patterns, which reflect system
Synoptic does not assume that the user knows these invariants, instead it mines them This better supports the goal of enabling log
Log invariants Synoptic mines three kinds of log invariants:
Log invariants Synoptic mines three kinds of log invariants:
Given a choice of two splits, perform the split that satisfies a previously unsatisfied invariant
Given a choice of merges, perform the merge that maintains all the log invariants
Termination condition: A log summary must preserve all log invariants

Evaluation: Peterson algorithm Leader election in a uni-directional ring network
Nodes are issued a random id and start as active
In each round of the protocol, an active node becomes a relay by comparing its ids with that of its two predecessors
The last active node to remain is the leader
Issuing spoofed timestamps Current hop TS unresponsive
More accurate than kTail [1], a popular coarsening algorithm
